review: Love this place. Service is always great! They are accurate in their wait time and service is always perfect! The menu is plentiful and everything is always fresh. The wait service is always friendly and happy Robbie there. I love that I can get burgers wrapped in lettuce and not worry about all of the carbs. This is one of my favorite burger joints.

I stopped in for lunch while on the road, mostly because I have that "Red Robin" tune stuck in my head and there isn't one on my normal track. The place was more or less empty so service was spot on. I picked one of their custom burgers (had 2 in mind and the waitress tipped it towards The Southern Charm). Burger was solid all around and comes with fries.  All in all, it was pretty good but a 14$ burger should be!

Three of us went for lunch yesterday. It seemed like it took a little longer than usual for the food to come out. Our server Jordan gave us a plate of fries until or order was up. I would like to compliment Jordan on his customer service skills. When our food did arrive it was good.

Celebrated the wife's birthday with the free birthday burger. Actually she wanted a chicken salad but our server said she had to order a burger. So she ordered the Shrum burger and I the salad. We then switched dinners when our food arrived. As always we enjoyed our food.

Guys, I've been here a few times and never once had a poor experience. The servers are always attentive and go the extra mile to make sure you leave happy. I always end up telling a manager how great my service and food was here.  I want to give a special shout out to Andrew. My girlfriend and I stopped by for lunch yesterday and decided to split a sandwich. Not only did we receive equal portions of everything we ordered, Andrew even set aside an order of piping hot fries for us to take home and enjoy later! Insider tip: Order the sweet potato fries with garlic aioli sauce. You will not be disappointed!
Great place for your usual burger! Being loud makes it a great place to bring young children. Favorite is the jalapeno burgers. The sweet potato fries are amazing!

I am, or at least I was, a big fan of Red Robin, and I said I was because I just ate there tonight and Im extremely disappointed. I ordered the burning love and my boyfriend ordered the guacamole bacon. Both burgers didnt have any seasoning whatsover!! My burger was extremely spicy and that was all I can taste. The avocado in my bf burger was so plain it wasnt even guacamole. And to top it off, the fries were hard, it was like chewing gum. I used to love eating here but after spending $30 and leaving half of the meal uneaten, I dont think Im coming back. Get it together Red Robin!!!

Went here on New Years Day, with our granddaughter.  Was not optimistic, based on trying one of these off the PA Turnpike near Reading, PA a couple times.  Very busy, but no wait for a booth.  Service was prompt, friendly and thorough. Looking good.  We all ordered burgers and were very happy with the results.  Cooked correctly, large size, good variety of choices.  Juicy, not greasy. Huge soft drinks that precluded the need for refills.  Nice surroundings.   Got enough fries with the original order that endless refills would have been gluttonous.  Overall, really enjoyed it, and want to go back and try some of the other menu items.

The very best chicken tortilla soup.  I also had a generous portion of the south west salad.  A good healthy choice and very delicious.  I would recommend this eatery to all.  Today I was told they broke there lunch time record.  I can see why.  Very friendly, patient, and helpful.  My cashier was Santiago and he was A number One.

Good place.  Good food.  Good service by Ryan tonight.   No complaints.   Food came out in a decent amount of time.   All food was prepared well.  The fries were a little off but Ryan recognized it and fixed it before we said anything.   We like the fries well done.   For some reason the bathrooms were not working tonight but it happens. I'm sure it will be fixed soon.

I love Red Robin and this location did not disappoint. I went twice during my weeklong visit to the area and brought different folks each time.  It was a hit with everyone, especially those that had never experienced a Red Robins. I had the black n blue burger the first time and the royal red robin the second time.  Fantastic both times.  I'm a picky orderer - I want this but not that, etc.  and they were accommodating each time.  Service was fast and courteous.  Did NOT disappoint!
Nothing but good things to say about Red Robin. Their bacon cheeseburger is probably the best burger on the planet.

Had lunch here today, staff friendly and efficient, food good and brought out timely, asked for a few modifications and received them with a smile, so why not five stars? I don't know I don't think they could have done much better but it just feels four star to me, definitely would go back again

just came from there. had a girl named sawyer or along those lines we finished our apps way before getting our food, then finished our food when she finally came back to the table we order desserts we got our desserts and not the entire time or appetizers plates and what they came out on stayed on the table we've been stacked everything to the end of the table so she could easily take it away and she left it there the entire time she didn't check to see if we were OK she gave us attitude when we asked for more water and dressing it's the worst service I've ever had and just because of her I will not be attending The red Robin and hamilton

This place is huge. But even so, the wait can be long at times. For a chain, it's not bad at all. They have over 20 burgers to choose from along with a whole regular menu of other foods. Best of all, their meals come with endless steak fries. Speaking of fries, they have frie seasoning at every table that's pretty damn good! Another plus is that they serve alcohol and the drink menu has a great selection.  I guess my only complaint is that they don't offer a monster burger. So with that said, 3 to 4 starts is the most that I can give any chain. Definitely not bad for the price though.

It's a Red Robin...it's the same as every other Red Robin. The location is quite large and our waitress was kind. One part of our order was forgotten but when the error was realized it was brought out quickly to our table. The drink sizes are absurd. They must give you a 26 ounce glass filled with liquid. It was a little ridiculous, but I guess they don't have to bring refills as often. The one thing I will say is that the honey mustard was frightening. It was toxic yellow and had SESAME SEEDS in it. What?? WHY?? So gross.

The service has always been very pleasant. Never an unhappy server. The burgers are always cooked to perfection. The onion ring order comes in two sizes. And the best is the serve drinks as in alcoholic, the best.

Went here with my mom around 7:30 for a late dinner. We got seated as soon as we walked in and our server Amber came right up to our table, took our drink orders, got them right away, dropped them off and then didnt come back for 10mins. After returning she took our appetizer and meal order then never stopped by our table until we were almost done with our meal. Luckily another server Joe who was passing by stopped by to check on us and was more than happy to get us what we needed. It wasn't until our server Amber, who seemed to be to busy taking care of the table next to us then to come check on us, saw us tip Joe for being so helpful and attentive that she finally came to ask us if we needed anything. We kindly told her no we're good and that Joe got us everything we needed, but before we could ask for the check she cut us off with a much filled attitude of "oh great" and left. She eventually returned with the check and a box. We honestly could not get out of there fast enough because of how irritating it was.

We've been here several times and never been disappointed.  We signed up for the rewards card and they give you free meal on your birthday!  Burgers are good, bottomless fries and pretty fairly priced!
Soooo glad they brought back the "old" garlic fries!!! Yes they are not as healthy but yummmmm

We had the best experience at the Red Robin, so I wanted to take the time to let everyone know how amazing a place this is.  We received delicious food, great drinks, and outstanding service.  Then, on top of all that, I lost an item of great value there, and they found it and kept it, hoping I would realize it was gone and call!  I noticed the next day, called, and they were so happy they had found it, and pleased to return it to me.  The workers there are so incredibly honest.  Had the same thing happened somewhere else, the outcome may have been much different.  You can be assured we will be going there again!

It's fast casual dining. My biggest gripe with this place is the prices for their food. $11.50 for chicken strips and fries. That's a lot for a place like this. $2.99 for an iced tea. That's a little high as well. I want to like this place more, but it really seems like their corporate management is trying to squeeze some extra pennies out of folks who, if they dine at RR-type places regularly, probably could use that money elsewhere.  tl;dr: Pricey, average quality food. You get what you pay for.

Server was great even though very busy. Had two spots while waiting for the rest of our party. Had the pretzels pieces  with beer cheese dip and the fried pickle nickels with the Ranch dressing for dipping. Both were very good. The pickles although a bit greasy were not overly spiced or salty like most are and were tasty as well. Having filled Up in spots I ordered a soup and salad combo. Had the loaded cream of potato soup -new to menu. It was tasty and plenty loaded with cheddar and bacon pieces but it did taste like a big dollop  of sour cream was stirred in. It could have been hotter for my taste.  The salad was the house salad with lettuce, chopped tomato, cucumber, shredded cheese and carrots. It was fresh and crisp and the blue cheese dressing was adequate.  One complaint, being near the kitchen with a straight on view into the kitchen -it was very messy. The floor was very wet, I do not know how any employees didn't skip and fall! There were paper sheets that may have come from between burgers all over the floor because the garbage container was overfilled. This garbage can was right up against what looked like a food keeper. Yuck. Over an hour and nothing cleaned up. The bathroom not too clean either! Clean up it up Red Robin!

Mmmm .... didn't quite hit the spot for me.  I've been craving for a "big, fat, juicy, melt in your mouth" burger lately. Walked in to this join with that expectation. I thought "hey it's a BURGER place! At least they must have decent burger" Wrong! I've been to Red Robin's other locations and it wasn't bad.  So that day I ordered the smoke and pepper burger.  It didn't enjoy it. The burger was dry.  The plate had grease mark and finger prints all over it.  The fries came in half full that it looked like a left over from the other table.  Yes the offer bottomless steak fries if we want more but that's not the point.  Prices are a little high too. I was going to give this join one-star.  But then I remembered how the waiter called me "Miss" (not "Mam"!!) ... for that, I added another star, to two-stars!  Lols ... I hope Yelp doesn't withdraw my elite badge for being a little narcissistic hahahaha

This Red Robin is great. They have many great deals like 20% off and military discounts. And the burgers are very juicy and cheesy (which I love). Also, the bottomless fries are great if I'm hungry and done with my entrée. To finish my review, they have many great options for children like mac & cheese, pasta, and pizza. They also have great options for adults.

The burgers are great as well as the tower of onion rings with ranch dressing. Service is a disaster. Make sure you allow yourself to be sober or get drunk before hand because it takes forever for refills. Allow at least 3 hours for lunch or dinner. That's how bad the service is. Management really needs to re-train these servers!

Only the second time I've been to a RR, the first time being at their Brick NJ location. We were seated as soon as we entered, requested a booth and was seated at a window seat near the outside area.  If it wasn't so warm out, even with the big umbrellas covering the tables, we would have sat there. Looked very clean and inviting. We will definitely be back, a burger and fries done the way you want it with virtually any and all toppings you want? Yah, I'll take that!

This chain is run well the service and people are always good. The food can sometimes be spotty. I know this is just a burger place but some days the burgers are cooked well with fresh ingredients and sometimes its like getting a fancy burger king. The appetizers are good our favorite is the mozzarella sticks when these are hot truly best around.  I will agree the menu can be a bit  pricey but its more of a sit down place so you aren't getting for less anywhere else.

Ate there with a friend on Saturday.  Both my husband and friend felt stomach pains about 20 minutes or left after leaving there, you can guess! Their fries were soggy, seemed like leftovers from another customer! My burger was "Meh" and cold. Not a great experience. We won't be returning any time soon.

Stopped in the other day and it was pretty busy but we got seated immediately. Our server was well versed on the menu and brought our drinks promptly. The burgers though were disappointing to say the least.  I don't understand how a restaurant that prides themselves on burgers aren't pumping out patties consistently at a high rate.  When we wanted a refill on our "bottomless" fries it took 15 minutes before I grabbed my server and told him I just wanted to check and to forget about the fries. Only went there because I had a gift card and certainly won't go back. Five guys could teach them a thing or two.

I came here for dinner after fright fest at six flags. The burgers here are good!! On top of that, our server, Jen was very kind and attentive which made the dining experience even better.  They give you bottomless fries (unlimited fries) with every order. Fries + burger = great meal.  The red tavern burgers are good and you can even order them in a petite size if the regular burger is too big for you. Plenty of parking in the lot.

Perfect for an inexpensive meal. Typical chain restaurant food. I would stick with burgers and sandwiches. They offer bottomless fries (steak or sweet potato) which is a nice perk if you are really hungry.  Recently, I had the grilled romaine salad with chicken for lunch and I liked it well enough (although it had too much dressing). I also tried the chicken and waffles sandwich, which was tasty. My husband had the black and blue burger and liked it.  The service is consistently good. The bar drinks are a little slow to come out especially when ordering a second mid meal, and it arrives when you've just about finished eating.  They have a good rewards program, buy 9, get 10th meal free.

This is a good chain restaurant for burgers and fries! My favorite burger is the whiskey BBQ burger and I got a garden veggie burger instead of meat. The flavor was great and tasty! They have the option to make any burger entree a vegan boca burger or a garden vegetarian burger which is great with no extra charge. All burgers come with bottomless fries. There tower of onion rings are so good! I got the Mac and cheese burger once and it wasn't good. It was lacking flavor, kind of tasteless. Don't get it! The service whenever I come here is pretty good, no complaints.

I was completely unaware of the existence of the Hamilton Marketplace uber-commercial zone until I returned to work in the area last year. Slowly, I have begun to visit the many restaurants there. Red Robin Gourmet Burgers is one of the offerings.   I stopped in for a late lunch last week when I had an urge for a good slider, but something better than the fast food variety, less greasy than Five Guys, and priced for most of us (sorry, Smashburger). Red Robin was bright and airy, with glass walls, high ceilings, and effective lighting.  As I approached, the front door was opened for me by a greeter who welcomed me and pointed toward the angled bar when I asked if I could sit there for lunch.   The bartender approached easily, asking if I wanted a drink and menu.  Indeed, I did.  The All American Patty Melt (medium) and Ice Tea would do me, thank you.  My meal arrived within 10 minutes on a large platter that held the Grilled Marble Rye Sandwich, the aluminum collar holding vertical French Fries, and a small container of dipping sauce.  After lifting the top lid and squirting ketchup over the Sautéed Onion and Pepper Jack Cheese that covered the beef, I lifted the first half of the triangle for a bite.  It was very good. Accurately medium finish; never frozen patty that held its shape throughout; softly translucent sweet onion and mildly spicy cheese.  Do so love a properly created patty melt!  But, it was a bit leaky with so much pressed within its rigid borders, that I resorted to fork and knife to devour the rest of it.   All the while, good rock & roll played a mix of songs I like, the HDTVs broadcast sports and news without sound, and the customer at the stool to my right kept the bartender occupied with a string of commentary about various innocuous topics.  I was happily alone with my tasty lunch.   With soft drink, the meal came in at just under $15, with tip.  Quite a deal for the enjoyment of good burger, attractive surroundings, and a little peace and solitude.

Haven't been here in a while. The bar staff were really great and made us feel welcomed. For appies, lightly breaded broccoli heads and spinach and artichoke dip which came with chips and celery. We had the Mad Love Burger with two kinds of cheeses (Parmesan and mozzarella), bacon, avocado, onions, and tomatoes, with garlic and Parmesan cheese fries - they had me at cheese. Calorie laden but tasty.  Been here several times, as a couple and in a group and it's always been a positive experience.

We stopped here for the first time in years on Sunday, July 9, 2017.   The burgers were prepared exactly as we ordered, and that's the good news. The not so good?   Well, the restrooms were not clean at all.  The service was hit-miss.   Our food came reasonably quickly, but we missed out on the "bottomless" fries.   Our waiter never returned to our table after our food was dropped off until we asked for our check.   So there was a full 20-30 minutes where no one asked or offered the bottomless fries refill.   Sure we could have randomly stopped someone else who worked there, but it would have been nice if our waiter had checked in on us at least every once in a while.  And no, the waiter wasn't spread thin  just didn't bother to stop by.   There also weren't that many tables seated at the time so stopping by just wasn't a priority. We probably won't be going back again to this location.   There are other Red Robin locations with better service and cleaner so we'll just skip this spot.

Not my favorite have tried several ones in different towns and I have to say this one is pretty good. Staff is friendly and fast to bring the bottomless fries I recommend ordering a sauce for the the fries the garlic is delicious.
Always on top of their game, no matter how big your party is. Delicious appetizers, menu choices, and sauces. I was excited to realize they have outdoor seating!

If I could give this review 0 stars I would. Heavy set manager with the weird name was completely rude and unprofessional as he accused a customer of lying. He was very rude to say the least and should lose his job.
Always loud and busy but a well trained staff makes this location a local favorite. Be sure to have a sweater, no matter where your table nor time of day or year it's always meat-locker cold.

I love Red Robin! It's a fun and casual spot for lunch or dinner. They have a big menu with more than just burgers. They also have a good drink menu with milkshakes and floats. Of course there's going to be a wait on the weekends here in Hamilton Marketplace but the host stand works hard at getting people seated very quickly. My favorites are the Banzaii burger and Nacho Crunch Tavern Double. I also like eating outside during the summer!

Consistent, consistent, consistent. All you can really ask for in a restaurant. In the crowded burger scene, Red Robin is head and shoulders above the rest. Service is always good, with friendly and attentive staff. Food is always cooked exactly as ordered and tasty. Sure its a chain, but it's one off the best chains in my opinion. Tried just about every one of their burgers over the years; Prime Chophouse is the best of them all. We've been here dozens of times over the past several years and have yet to have a bad experience. Way to go Red Robin.

Of the local reasonably inexpensive burger chains, Red Robin gets my vote when I'm eating at the restaurant. Cheeburger's theme and harsh lighting are not my favorite, Bobby's Burger Palace feels slightly overpriced, I don't love the fries at 30 Burgers... I'm sure there are others around here that I've tried, but that's the peer group I'm going for here. I always leave a little fuller than I feel like I should allow myself to be, and I usually steer clear of chains, but so it goes. If I'm in a steak fry mood, this is my go-to. Bring an extra sweatshirt -- the a/c can be extra cold at times.

Of the generic chain restaurants, I think Red Robin is one of the better ones. Their menu is pretty extensive and reasonably priced.  We came in on a Sunday evening and it was pretty busier than I expected, but the wait was only about 10 minutes. Our server was cheerful and friendly. I ordered some kind of Guinness milkshake and my friend had the Blue Moon one and both were amazing.  My only complaint is that my burger was way too overcooked to be considered medium rare. I'm not sure if places like this purposely overcook their meat for health reasons, but that was disappointing for someone who likes their meat on the juicier side.

Very good place to get gourmet burgers. I tried almost every single kind and wasn't disappointed with any of them. The fries are big and ok. Sometimes overcooked but more hit than miss. I do like the condiment options for the fries including buzzard sauce and tasty ranch. The gingerbread shake that is served during the winter holiday is fantastic. It seems that when it is very crowd the kitchen staff preparing the food gets very overwhelmed and you could be waiting for a long time. Less crowded brings a better experience. However, Will always enjoy this guilty pleasure restaurant.

I absolutely love it there! I go there all the time because of the delicious food and friendly staff. Definitely a most go and I love that they offer gluten free buns and fries. I can't wait to go back!

I think I say this about pretty much every Red Robin location. Their burgers are expensive for what you get. Creative? Maybe. Unique? Perhaps. But some of their burgers have crept over the $10 mark! Give me a break! Service at this location is above average though. The server was attentive and asked if I needed drink and fries refills just before I got to the point of asking for those. This location does handle Red Royalty rewards, which is a plus as I've had trouble using this loyalty card at some other Red Robin locations. (Why, oh why, can't the Red Robin chain stick with one reward system?)

I went here on Friday with a party of 6. The hamburgers are half the normal size at this particular red robins. No I'm not joking. For me it was enough but not for a man expecting a red robin hamburger. The food tastes great however the fries and root beer floats ( with purchase ) are endless if your waiter/waitress isn't busy running back and forth to several other tables. It seemed as if they had one to many hostesses standing around the front and not enough waitress/waiters to cover tables. I went to use the restroom on our way out and a little girl was on the john complaining to a family member that she had an upset stomach after eating her meal.

So do you really need a description for what Red Robin is?  Works for us.....family of four, looking for a casual place out, that won't break the bank.  This location hasn't disappointed us relative to food quality, service, and wait time.

Red Robin is awesome! I don't get the reviews of these other commentators regarding the pricing!! You're getting great size burgers with amazing selections regarding burger creativity and delicious bottomless steak fries. You pay more when you go to McDonald's/Burger King!! So seriously lets not be unrealistic here.  Some waiters may not be all knowing but that's typical when they are new, so give them a break! I've been here often and will continue to go and the service is great, the food is awesome and the general manager Scott is very accommodating. Our server today is Barbara and she's the sweetest thing.  I give it 5 stars because I've never had a bad experience .

for a chain resto, red robin is a pretty solid spot. i am obsessed with the lettuce bun option... sometimes, a girl just needs a portable cheeseburger salad. don't judge me. like most chain restos, the service at this red robin location vascillates from awesome to mediocre to sometimes disappointing. the food is consistent and pretty yummy. the wait, if anything, is usually pretty short.  they give kids balloons.  the water glasses are gigantic (yay for not having to wait for multiple refills). they have garlic-parm bottomless fries, if you ask for them. DO IT. they accomodate special requests. they have gluten-free buns. they have lettuce buns, and this is why i go.
Nice, cute... Good wait staff. Accommodating to dietary requests, but left off items that should have been included.
Good burger casual dining place.  Always get the Royal Robin burger (burger with bacon and sunny side-up eg on top).   We get takeout from here usually as there is a wait on weekends.
Service at this Red Robin is A plus!!!! Hostess and management were very polite!!!!! Food is excellent!!!!!
Lunchtime Getting the signature burger. Trying the Gooey Chocolate Brownie cake for dessert this time.

I love RR restaurants. Went there Sunday and the burger wasnt very good. The bun looked like a car drove over it (flat). It just didnt live up to the standard I know around the USA. Soo disappointing. Worst of all the guy serving me was not pleasant.  I went again to give another chance and it was day and night! Server was friendly and the burger was great as usual at RR. Also the hostesses are very friendly.
Service stunk! Waitress disappeared for a half hour! Food wasn't that good. Don't come here!!! Going to Fridays.  Red Robin...STUUUUNK!!
Really good onion rings. I'd go back just for them. The burgers aren't bad either

For the vegetarians out there- this is a winner. We can STILL eat at a burger joint and NOT have to ord I get the boca burgers here, and have only been to one location--- we sometimes order the burgers out but it gets cold and we dont enjoy it as much Sit down, order ANY type of cheese/dressing/style/seasoning you want, make it a boca burger instead, and it tastes as good as the meat ones do... either way, I see people happy--- its a great family place as well... and the desserts are yum as well... as for the fries, we all love them, but typically have to add more seasoning on it (the ones they leave on the table).... but great place!

I was craving a burger today and decided to go to a place I never been to.  I was very pleased with my all american patty melt with fries.  I will definitely visit again to try some of the other menu items. Also, the staff were very nice and polite.

A mouth watering experience. This is my second time at Red Robin. The first time was during lunch with my little sister. The second time was tonight (take out)- before work. Both time I've been here, Red Robin never failed me. Their portion was huge; and they're not that expensive either. Go try their new Prime Chophouse Burger - that's not a meal for your strict diet though. You can choose how the meat going to be cooked.. from rare to the usual well done. The waiting time isn't that bad as well. It's only 5 to 10 mins. Service for both ocassion, dine in + take out, was friendly. No complain at all. The place is also family friendly, even though they served beer and stuffs. Expect waiting time on the weekends, for this place gets mad crowded.

My daughter had a soccer tournament at Fort Dix and we were clueless to the area. Always looking to try a new burger spot. Place is like a Friday's/Houlihan's...... We were seated right away. Place is "family and loud",service was fast. App's : Daughter had mozzarella sticks, wife and I shared the onion ring tower.... both were good Burgers were big and pretty good and they had a good selection. I'm just a bacon/cheese guy. Would recommend it if you're in the mood for a burger.

we LOVE coming to Red Robin. My husband deploys in a bit so we are trying to eat at all his favorite restaurants before he leaves. So last night, he chose Red Robin. We always get The Whiskey River burger and the Banzai...and as always the food was delicious! BUT what made our trip even more special was our server, Andrew. Andrew introduced himself and the man he was training, Vinny. Andrew was AMAZING! He was very attentive and had a great sense of humor. When my husband showed his military ID so that he could receive a Blue Moon, Andrew and Vinny both expressed thankfulness and appreciation of him being in the Military. We enjoyed our dinner and made some small talk with them. Our drinks were filled always and Andrews mannerisms were awesome! he brought us our check, which included the military discount, which was extremely appreciative and he thanked my husband for his service, once again. We have lived in New Jersey for only a year and we eat out a lot...and we have never have had as GREAT as service as we did from Andrew!!! keep him around! he is definitely an asset to your company!!

Stopped in here on the way home from a cheerleading competition in AC. Great waitstaff.  Shout out to ED!  Out appetizer and drinks came out quickly--entrees too.  Great when the kid is dying of hunger after a long day of activity and no food.  The restaurant seemed pretty busy, but the kitchen and bar were on top of it. Food was consistent with other Red Robin locations.  Really, isn't this what a chain is about?  Onion rings were hot and well coated, dip was nice.  Hamburger was exactly as it should be, even when a kid ordered medium rare.  Waiter offered to upgrade me to a bowl from a cup of soup.  Can't blame a guy for trying.  Drinks were filled as needed.  Restrooms were clean.  Check came out promptly. We were seated in the bar area, but on a snowy Saturday night, it was pretty much date night and not a rowdy bar night.  Not sure it that even happens here, but I had no qualms sitting in that area with a 13 year old.
Good food. Black and blue burger was delicious. My blackened salmon was good just a little oversalted. One complaint they seem to forget things like dipping sauces. Bottomless sides nice touch.

Well - I guess if you got o Red Robin you know what you are getting - greasy food that is not good for you, but they do have nice ice cream :)  We went for a kids fund raiser, not a normal stop for us - and the burgers were fine.

We stopped into Red Robin tonight for some clam strips and beer and decided to sit at the bar. The previous patrons empties and dirty dishes were still there but the bartender said she would clean it right up. 5 minutes later still not clean so my husband asked the other bartender if she would clean the bar and give us menus. The bartender said yes and then walked away to take other orders. Another 5 minutes went by and the first bartender asked what we wanted to drink. My husband asked again for the bar to be cleaned. She swiped some of the food particles off and gave us menus. After taking a few more drink orders the bartender got us our drinks and asked about food...that's when we found out about no clam strips. Oh well, we decided to pass on food. The bartender gave us the check but never came back to collect and bring change. We finally found smaller bills to cover the check and left. Service was horrible and there is no excuse. There were two bartenders on and empty seats at the bar.

Despite the negative connotation of being a chain restaurant we have never had a bad experience here!  Wait staff is always courteous and attentive!  Fold is good and they are very attentive to allergy concerns!  We especially love the new interactive allergen menu!  It lets you customize the menu to your specific needs rather than having to flip through a dozen pages finding what you can or cannot have!

I normally love Red Robin, but tonight's food seemed less than fresh. I'm not much of a complainer, and it still tasted pretty good so I didn't say anything. My date didn't seem to have any problems with it. I had to send him home early though because I started not feeling so well.

Placed a take out order on a fundraiser day so I called way in advance to make sure it could be ready at the right time. It wasn't : \  Everything tasted great, but pick up took very long and was incredibly disorganized.
I'm not usually a fan of chain restaurants, but this one is an A+. Their fries are some of the best I've ever had and the bacon cheeseburger was to die for. So good!

I don't know about number 655, I'm pretty sure I've reviewed this place already but here it goes again. For a chain, the burgers are pretty damn good and never taste frozen. Nice selection of appetizers. The onion rings are really good, but what makes them even better are the dipping sauces that accompany them!! Fried zucchini, mmmmm....... I really like the fact that you can order any burger lettuce wrapped instead of on a bun!!!  Great for those of us that watch our carbs!!  Service is usually very good. I would avoid this place during peak hours, I'm sure you wont want to be waiting that long if you are starving!!

This spot is perfect for kids, nice and loud and the service is fast.  The burgers are tasty and just about everyone can find something to eat.  If I want a quick dinner with the kids this is the spot.  And they have alcohol.  Always a plus after a tough day!

The Pros: Lot's of hamburger choices with various toppings and hamburger buns, endless french fry options, no charge for replacing fries with a healthier alternative such as a salad. The Cons: Your waitress will leave and other waitresses will bring your food/ wait on you only for your original waitress to re-appear at the end asking for a tip. Loud children everywhere, can't hear yourself talk.  Overall: Disappointing experience overall. My first time at Red Robin and it will probably be the last. Within a one hour span I've never heard a "birthday chant" repeated so many times in my life...This restaurant seems to cater exclusively to families with kids. The restaurant was noisy both from the kids and the people cooking the food (me and my mother were seated at a table located right next to the kitchen. The cook had to scream in order to be heard over the overall "loudness" of the restaurant itself.)   Recommendations: Go to this restaurant if you want a big hamburger with endless french fries! Otherwise, stay far far away. This is not a good date spot nor is it a quite place to enjoy a meal and chat with friends. I highly recommend just doing their take-out option. Otherwise go during non-peak hours such as before 5pm or avoiding Friday - Sunday.

Went to this Red Robin Today and they said about 15 minutes, but it wasn't 15 minutes it was like 1 or 2 sat down pretty quick that's a nice start. Took a while for the waiter to come we but our order in about 5 minutes to 1 O'clock Five minutes later our drinks came out not even our food came out so quick I got Grilled Cheese and Fries it was pretty good Even though I don't come here often I will come back

The two times I have been to this location I was less than impressed. Both times the floor staff were very accommodating however the service was rather slow.  The first time I chalked it up to being apart of a larger group (7 people) however the second time was no better (only 3 people this time). The food both times lacked any real flavor  however my husband did think the fries were amazing.  I don't know if I will be going back, it really didn't leave an awesome impression on me.

I go there for lunch occasionally while at work. The beer menu is bland, but acceptable. I always ask them to send out a plate of well done fries while waiting for the food,. That is the only way their fries are acceptable for me, and they are accomodating for that. I always get their bacon blue cheese burger which is awesome. Service is acceptable, but seem overworked, and the manager comes over numerous times to annoy us if everything is alright. Would be OK if he didnt always interrupt someone carrying on a conversation.

Had a salad, which was good.  Others had different burgers.  I may sound crazy, but $9 for a burger seems a bit much.  Endless fries, yes.  But how many fries can you eat?  Our batch this time was a bit too salty too.  Had a brownie desert with a scoop of ice cream for $4.29.  It was good, but should be $3.29.  The waitress was attentive and friendly.  I didn't like sitting as close to the door as we were seated because it got cold every time the door opened, but we dealt with it.  Final thought- food good, service good, but I don't go without a coupon.

I just want to know if your burgers come in precooked and frozen???  My girlfriend and I decided to stop in your establishment this evening for a couple of burgers around 9. We were greeted and sat immediately by a charismatic hosting staff. Our server was a gentleman in his mid twenties, polite and neatly groomed. Unfortunately despite a good foh staff the rest of the meal was significantly underwhelming. Both burgers were ordered medium and came out within three minutes very well done. No pink color, no juice, no seasoning, I'm not one to complain so I didn't bother. I choked down what I could and shelled out 40$. I would really like to know if your burgers are pre cooked and warmed up to order? They both had the taste and texture of sawdust and not what you would expect from a restaurant known for "gourmet" hamburgers.  I didn't get to voice my complaint with management because I didn't see a manager my entire visit and I didn't want to bother a server with circumstances beyond his control. I don't think you could've made these burgers any worse.

My first experience on April 11 - 8:00pm - The service was great but why would anyone want to eat a burger there?  Only two cooking choices - "Little pink or no pink".  I asked for as much pink as a possible on for my Bacon Blue Cheese burger. Although the burger was presented nicely, the burger patty was dry and gray with a touch of pink in the middle and no seasoning.  When are cooks going to stop pressing on the patty on the grill it does nothing but delete the meat of all the juices. I could not taste the blue cheese and the bacon so think it was had to find under the bun. The all you can eat frys were OK - not bad but not fantastic either. Don't think I'll be back anytime soon.

Normally love Red Robin, but this time around the service was horrible and the gourmet burger made my friend throw up. They didn't even offer to remove the burger from her bill after she told them. I will never go back to this Red Robin again.

Stopped in here with Melissa Leigh and Joey the other night. I've been here several times and it's usually pretty good. Unfortunately this last time was by far the worst. We were seated immediately and our waitress asked us for our order a minute later. We said give us a minute and then we waited, and waited and waited some more. Finally the manager saw us looking desperate and sent our server over. Somebody else brought out our soups and salads and somebody else brought us our meals.  I had the New England Clam Chowder, a dish upon which I'm a world renowned expert and the Chowder here is GREAT! Each and every time I have it. The place is allegedly famous for its burgers, and I've had em before and they are good. I had the Fish and Chips this night for a change of pace but regretted it when it came. The fish was downright greasy and the chips were merely the same fries everybody else gets with their burgers. Extremely disappointing. I figured if they got the Chowder so right the same might be true for the other seafood dishes, but I sure was wrong.  I've eaten here with Debbi Faye and we like to sit at the very small bar, maybe 8 or 10 seats because the place is often, as it was this last time, over run with little, screaming, ill behaved, bratty kids. Not sure what it is with this place as I can't think of any other place I've been to like that. Must be something in the local water.  After we got our food this last time we never saw our waitress again until we were ready to leave, and i was really in the mood for a second brewskie. It took another eternity to get our check and the place was not crowded. To be honest, the service has always been fine before here so maybe we caught our server on a bad night or maybe she just sucks as a waitress. But the combination of bad service, bratty kids, mediocre food, way too bright lighting, and other places right in the same "Marketplace", where they have WalMarts, Kohl's, etc and Fridays, just might mean I've been here for the last time.

I liked it here. I thought the food was good and it wasn't crazy overpriced for a chain, either.  However... I went on a weeknight and it was shockingly PACKED. I was kind of annoyed that they sat us so uncomfortably close to another table, but thankfully they put us somewhere else or I wouldn't have eaten there.  Service - ehhh. I thought the fries were supposed to be "bottomless" but we had to keep asking for refills. I know the servers are busy but those are the reasons people come to this place in the first place.

This is a nice store and its nicely maintained.  Staff is generally courteous and never had a problem here.  Food is just so-so in my opinion, which is surprising considering its called a "Gourmet budget" but to me its just a burger.  Nice sized bar here which is something I have to look more into as well.

Love red robin, love their burgers, and loooove their fries! Everything is always consistent. The only reason I gave it four stars is because of their staff. There is always new staff, and they never really seem to know what's going on.

I know, this is a chain, but the burgers are still good.  one of the best burger places in the area.  I love the Blue Ribbon Burger with some pink and love the endless fries.  We frequent this place often and always the food is good.
Check out the "no bun" protein burger. Cool crisp lettuce wrapped around burger. Nice selection of beer on tap.

Typical Red Robin for the most part. I ordered a burger that was supposed to come with a fried egg on it, however when I received my burger the egg had been fully cooked. Any chef worth anything should be able to properly fry an egg and if they happen to break the yolk or over cook an egg they simply should not serve it.

I have definitely experienced better. The burger I had was so-so. Nothing special. Definitely not gourmet and no where near contender for best burger. Not even anywhere close. You would do much better to eat at Five Guys or a decent diner or pub. The service was great, I have to say that. Too bad the food wasn't. I wouldn't go back unless I had to. I'd rather go somewhere else for a burger. Oh yeah, and I love steak fries, but their steak fries were also so-so. Red Robin boasts about their burgers in their advertisements, but in my opinion, it's all just marketing.

The family and I went here on the fourth after a long day of flying from Cali.  Even though we arrived an hour before close, the staff was friendly and accommodating.  We ordered our "usual" from back home and were pleased.  I was happy to see that they offered a half order of mozzarella sticks (6) for $3.99.  Unless this is a new thing at RR, this is not on the menu back home.

finally made it after that damn garmin get me lost. i simply ordered 'fish and chips'. i liked the cod, worth the price for 4 pieces, except did not like the salty fat fries. if these fries goes with burger, i'll never going to order it. i'll try something else in the menu to have a better luck next time.
